member.name: T:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance
member.summary: A Device Instance representing a device in the system.

member.name: M:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.GetRoot
member.summary: Gets a tree of all devices, starting from the root, for devices that are available in the system.
member.returns: A tree of objects. If there was a problem retrieving the tree, is returned
member.exception: This is only supported on Windows NT platforms.

member.name: M:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.GetList
member.summary: Gets the list of all devices in the system, even if they're not physicall present.
member.returns: A list of all devices in the system.
member.exception: This is only supported on Windows NT platforms.
member.remarks: Even though the list is returned as a flat list, the and fields can be used to build a device tree. The easiest way to get the root node of the tree is to call after calling this method. It will only locate the root node, and won't reiterate the children.

member.name: M:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.GetList(RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.LocateMode)
member.summary: Gets the list of all devices in the system, even if they're not physicall present.
member.param: The query mode when locating devices.
member.returns: A list of all devices in the system.
member.remarks: Even though the list is returned as a flat list, the and fields can be used to build a device tree. The easiest way to get the root node of the tree is to call after calling this method. It will only locate the root node, and won't reiterate the children.

member.name: P:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.Handle
member.summary: Gets the underlying handle of the DevInst for the CfgMgr32 API.

member.name: P:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.Children
member.summary: Get the children device instances from this node.

member.name: P:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.Status
member.summary: Gets the status of the device at the time it was enumerated.
member.value: The status of the device at the time it was enumerated.

member.name: P:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.HasProblem
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance has problem.
member.value: Returns if this instance has problem; otherwise, .

member.name: P:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.ProblemCode
member.summary: Gets the problem code for this driver if it has a problem.
member.value: The problem code for this driver.

member.name: P:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.Service
member.summary: Gets the name of the service.

member.summary: Gets the class name of the device.

member.name: P:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.ClassGuid
member.summary: Gets the class unique identifier of the device.

member.name: P:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.Manufacturer
member.summary: Gets the manufacturer of the device or driver.
member.value: The manufacturer of the device or driver.

member.name: P:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.FriendlyName
member.summary: Gets the friendly name of the device.

member.name: P:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.Location
member.summary: Gets the location of the device.

member.summary: Gets the configuration flags for the device.

member.summary: Gets the capability flags of the device.

member.name: P:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.LocationPaths
member.summary: Gets the compatible ids (Windows 2003 and later).

member.name: M:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.GetDeviceProperties
member.summary: Gets the names of the keys for the device from the registry.
member.returns: An array of all the keys for the device from the registry. This can be then used with .

member.returns: The result. If the key doesn't exist, is returned.

member.param: The value to return if the key doesn't exist.

member.name: M:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.Refresh
member.remarks: This method should be used if it is believed that this node, and the children might have changed. Refreshing from this tree will remove nodes that are not currently connected / existing, thus removing entries that may have been populated by .

member.name: M:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceInstance.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: T:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem
member.remarks: Obtained from 'cfg.h' from the Windows SDK.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.LegacyServiceNoDevices
member.summary: Loaded legacy service created no devices.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.DuplicateDevice
member.summary: Two devices were discovered with the same name.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.FailedPostStart
member.summary: The drivers set the device state to failed.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.Halted
member.summary: This device was failed post start via usermode.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.Phantom
member.summary: The devinst currently exists only in the registry.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.HeldForEject
member.summary: The device is offline awaiting removal.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.DriverBlocked
member.summary: One or more drivers is blocked from loading.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.RegistryTooLarge
member.summary: System hive has grown too large.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.SetPropertiesFailed
member.summary: Failed to apply one or more registry properties.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.WaitingOnDependency
member.summary: Device is stalled waiting on a dependency to start.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.UnsignedDriver
member.summary: Failed load driver due to unsigned image.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.UsedByDebugger
member.summary: Device is being used by kernel debugger.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.ConsoleLocked
member.summary: Device is blocked while console is locked.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceProblem.NeedClassConfig
member.summary: Device needs extended class configuration to start.

member.name: T:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus
member.remarks: The device status is retrieved from the Config Manager API (see cfg.h). It is also dependent on the running Operating System. As the codes are dependent also on the Operating System being compiled (due to reuse of some of the codes), some of the older codes might not be available on newer Operating Systems. This list uses Windows XP as a baseline.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.DriverBlocked
member.summary: One or more drivers are blocked from loading for this Devnode.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.NeedRestart
member.summary: System needs to be restarted for this device to work properly.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.ChildWithInvalidId
member.summary: One or more children have invalid ID(s).

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.LegacyDriver
member.summary: This device is using a legacy driver.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.MultiFunctionParent
member.summary: Multi function parent. Up until Windows 8.x.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.MultiFunctionChild
member.summary: Multi function child. Up until Windows 8.x.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.StopFreeResources
member.summary: When child is stopped, free resources.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.BadPartial
member.summary: This device's log_confs do not have same resources.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.NtEnumerator
member.summary: This device is an NT enumerator.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.NtDriver
member.summary: This device is an NT driver.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.NeedsLocking
member.summary: Device need lock resume processing. This is up to Windows 7.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.ArmWakeup
member.summary: Device can be the wakeup device.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.BootLogProblem
member.summary: Had a problem during preassignment of boot log conf.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.DeviceDisconnected
member.summary: The function driver for a device reported that the device is not connected. Typically this means a wireless device is out of range. This is in Windows 8 and later.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.QueryRemovePending
member.summary: Device is part of a set of related devices collectively pending query-removal. This is in Windows 10 and later.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.DeviceStatus.QueryRemoveActive
member.summary: Device is actively engaged in a query-remove IRP. This is in Windows 10 and later.

member.name: T:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.LocateMode
member.summary: Defines how devices should be enumerated.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.LocateMode.Normal
member.summary: Retrieves the device instance handle for the specified device only if the device is currently configured in the device tree.

member.name: F:RJCP.IO.DeviceMgr.LocateMode.Phantom
member.summary: Retrieves a device instance handle for the specified device if the device is currently configured in the device tree or the device is a nonpresent device that is not currently configured in the device tree.

member.name: M:RJCP.Native.Marshalling.GetMultiSz(System.Char*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a list of strings from a Win32 API MULTI_SZ type.
member.param: The blob of character data to convert from.
The number of bytes returned for the blob.
member.remarks: Getting the multiple strings is used in many different Win32 API, not just the registry. It iterates through the blob, separating strings by the NUL character. The end of the list has two NUL characters.

member.name: M:RJCP.Native.Win32.Kernel32.CloseHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.param: A valid handle to an open object.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: T:RJCP.Native.Win32.SafeDevInst
member.summary: Gets a handle to the CfgMgr32 DevInst object.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:RJCP.Native.Win32.SafeDevInst.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The handle to assign to this object.

member.name: M:RJCP.Native.Win32.SafeDevInst.ReleaseHandle
member.summary: Executes the code required to free the handle.
member.returns: Returns if the handle is released successfully; otherwise, in the event of a catastrophic failure, . In this case, it generates a releaseHandleFailed MDA Managed Debugging Assistant.
